Posts.Title: Stage III'er needs your help! It's QUICK. please!!!! lisalisa cherneski

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2009 05:05PM anm wrote: Bette-I don't know how helpful this is as I have not had bc but walked every step with my mom through ibc to every appointment and treatment.  Looking back I truly wish we had gone somewhere that offered clinical trials.  If we had it to do over again I would definitely find out what is available and if she qualified for one.  Being that you are going to Johns Hopkins I'm sure there are clinical trials that might be worth checking into.  I wish you the best of luck and pray for you.
Posts.Title: Where do I go from here? bettelou68 bettelou68

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2009 11:04AM anm wrote: Good Morning,  I completely understand your worrying.  As I posted before my mom was diagnosed w IBC and has a very strong history of breast and ovarian cancers in her family.  She carried the BRCA2 gene which has made me a basket case worrying as well as I have had a couple scares.  My gyno finally suggested I take a low dose of zoloft to see if it would help take the edge off as my thoughts were consuming everything around me.  I can definitely say it worked!!!  I have always been skeptical of taking those types of medicine but I feel so much better!!  Might be worth checking into.  I am a little confused as to why you have to wait for results of an ultrasound.  I have them done every 6 months due to family history and I know right away.  Maybe different drs do them differently but I've never experienced waiting.  Also, if you have to go in to get your results from the dr I would strongly suggest taking someone with you.  Hopefully nothing will be wrong but if they were to find something you need someone there to help you hear and absorb everything they are telling you.  I was with my mom that day and it is overwhelming. Best of luck and I'll be praying for you!!!!
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 03:32PM anm wrote: Don't want to alarm you, but if you are not comfortable with whatever answers you get request a breast MRI.  There are types of breast cancer that cannot be detected by mammogram or ultrasound.  If you think there is something not right with your breast you deserve to find out what it is.  My mother had symptoms come up that were not of "typical" breast cancers and went on for months before being diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer.  Demand the tests you want.  As far as I know a breast MRI should show anything that might be going on as well as a biopsy.  Best of luck.
